content.question: On the surface of Planet <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mi>X</mi></mstyle></mrow></math>, a <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> object is thrown upward with a speed of <math alttext="20 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> </mtext><mfrac><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>s</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. The object’s vertical velocity as a function of time is shown in the graph. Which of the following free-body diagrams represents the gravitational force exerted on the object while it is in free fall?

choices.label: The figure presents a 10 by 10 grid labeled F sub Gravity equals 2 newtons. An arrow extends vertically downward one unit from a point on the top of the grid.
The figure presents a 10 by 10 grid labeled F sub Gravity equals 4 newtons. An arrow extends vertically downward 2 units from a point on the top of the grid.
The figure presents a 10 by 10 grid labeled F sub Gravity equals 8 newtons. An arrow extends vertically downward 4 units from a point on the top of the grid.
The figure presents a 10 by 10 grid labeled F sub Gravity equals 20 newtons. An arrow extends vertically downward 10 units from a point on the top of the grid.

content.answer: The figure presents a 10 by 10 grid labeled F sub Gravity equals 8 newtons. An arrow extends vertically downward 4 units from a point on the top of the grid.

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
